summary: This is an incident report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center dated August 9, 2019, detailing a contraband handoff attempt during a visit. A female visitor passed an unknown object to inmate Jeffrey Epstein (listed under the name Fernandez Leonardo), leading to his search, placement on dry cell status, and the visitor's detention and release.

persons.name: Fernandez Leonardo
persons.context: The inmate, registered as 86824.054, is the recipient of an unknown object passed by a female visitor during a visit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He denied possession, attempted to avoid providing a urine sample, and was placed on dry cell status.

persons.name: Unknown Female Visitor
persons.context: A female visitor who produced an unknown object from her waistband and handed it to inmate Fernandez Leonardo during a visit. She was detained, questioned, and later released.

persons.name: 9 South Visiting Officer
persons.context: The officer who observed the contraband handoff from the female visitor to inmate Fernandez Leonardo during routine duties.

connections.description: Visitor-inmate relationship; the visitor attempted to pass an unknown object to the inmate during a visit.

events.title: Contraband Handoff Attempt at MCC
events.description: A female visitor passed an unknown object from her waistband to inmate Jeffrey Epstein (under the name Fernandez Leonardo) during a visit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Staff intervened, escorted the inmate for search, and placed him on dry cell status after he attempted to avoid providing a urine sample. The visitor was detained, questioned, and released.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.context: The federal detention facility where the contraband incident occurred.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is referenced under the inmate name 'Fernandez Leonardo' with registration number 86824.054 in this MCC incident report.
On August 9, 2019, a female visitor attempted to pass an unknown object to Epstein during a visit, which was intercepted by correctional staff.
Epstein denied possessing contraband and attempted to avoid providing a urine sample by pouring water into the testing cup, leading to his placement on dry cell status.
The female visitor was detained and questioned but was later released; no staff injuries were reported.
This incident occurred while Epstein was in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York prior to his death.
